Term.Name: Trailer
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to a trailer of the currently described resource

Term.Name: HasTrailer
Term.Definition: The reference points to a trailer of the currently described resource

Term.Name: IsTrailerOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to a resource of which the currently described resource is a trailer

Term.Name: GroupTrailer
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to a trailer for the group of resources currently described.

Term.Name: HasGroupTrailer
Term.Definition: The reference points to a trailer for the group of resources currently described.

Term.Name: IsGroupTrailerOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to a group of resources for which the currently described resource is a trailer.

Term.Name: Sibling
Term.Definition: The reference points to a sibling of the current resource. Example: Record the next episode in a series whilst watching an earlier episode

Term.Name: Alternative
Term.Definition: The reference points to an alternative version of the current resource. Example: Whilst watching a programme, or part of programme, the user is able to discover that a high definition version is available elsewhere

Term.Name: Parent
Term.Definition: The reference points to a group of resources to which belongs the current resource. Example: "Record an entire series, whilst watching one of the episodes"

Term.Name: Recommendation
Term.Definition: The reference points to a resource recommended by the provider of the current resource. The service provider considers there to be similarities between the currently described resource and the referenced resource. Example: This could provide access to previous or next episodes or to all episodes (the parent series as a whole). Suggestion to record a programme which the broadcaster recommends because of what the user is watching.It could also point to a Web site proposing related programmes 'recommended' by the service provider. A recommendation can be used to suggest content or services or services bundles with a similar subject.

Term.Name: GroupRecommendation
Term.Definition: The reference points to a group of resources recommended by the provider of the current resource. The service provider considers there to be similarities between the currently described resource and the referenced group of resources. Example: Suggestion to record a series which the broadcaster recommends because of what the user is watching.

Term.Name: Commercial advert
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to the advert for a product or service featured in the current resource. Example: The user is watching a film containing a desirable product. If the user indicates interest in that product an advert is captured providing further information

Term.Name: Normal Advert
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to the normal advert for a product or service featured in the current resource

Term.Name: HasNormalAdvert
Term.Definition: The reference points to the normal advert for a product or service featured in the current resource

Term.Name: IsNormalAdvertOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource advertised by the current normal advert

Term.Name: Telescoped Advert
Term.Definition: An extended version of an advertisement. By default, the reference points to the telescoped advert for a product or service featured in the current resource

Term.Name: HasTelescopedAdvert
Term.Definition: The reference points to the telescoped advert for a product or service featured in the current resource

Term.Name: IsTelescopedAdvertOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource advertised by the current telescoped advert

Term.Name: Speedbump
Term.Definition: The superimposition of related or unrelated content over content in trick play mode. By default, the reference points to the speedbump for a product or service featured in the current resource

Term.Name: HasSpeedbump
Term.Definition: The reference points to the speedbump for a product or service featured in the current resource

Term.Name: IsSpeedbumpOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource advertised by the current speedbump

Term.Name: Direct product purchase
Term.Definition: The reference points to a product or service directly linked to the current resource, which can be purchased directly from this linked resource. Example: The user is watching a film containing a desirable product or service (The recipe book from a cookery series for instance). If the user indicates interest in that product they are taken to a web page (or interactive application) which is able to fulfil their purchasing requirement

Term.Name: For more information
Term.Definition: The reference points to additional information concerning the current resource in the form of audio/video/text/graphics/interactive app/web content. Example: The user watching a programme for which the content provider has made available additional information. If the user indicates interest they are taken directly to that additional content and then returned to the original content

Term.Name: Programme E-mail Address
Term.Definition: The e-mail address for the resource complying with "mailto:" URI scheme.

Term.Name: Programme Website
Term.Definition: The website for the resource expressed as a URL.

Term.Name: Telephone Number
Term.Definition: The telephone number for the resource complying with [IETF RFC 2806] "tel:" URI scheme.

Term.Name: Programme Transcript
Term.Definition: The transcript of the resource expressed as a URI.

Term.Name: Interactive Enhancement
Term.Definition: An interactive enhancement of the resource. The object pointed to may be an external resource. Alternatively, it may be the CRID of a ProgramInformation or Package record. The availability of an enhancement may be presented to the end user as a "red button" icon or similar, as defined by the application itself.

Term.Name: Recap
Term.Definition: The reference points to a text or av recap of the resource. Example: The user can chose to read/watch a recap if they have missed a previous episode or forgotten the thread of the series

Term.Name: The making of
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to the making-of of the current resource. Example: "The user, if interested can view the background to how the programme was made"

Term.Name: HasMakingOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the making-of of the current resource

Term.Name: IsMakingOfFor
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource corresponding to the current making-of

Term.Name: Support
Term.Definition: The reference points to a resource that contains issues the user may wish to enquire about. Example: The user can find out if there is support in the form of a telephone help line, postal or email address or web page that provides them with the ability to seek advice on the subject matter of the programme

Term.Name: Support E-mail Address
Term.Definition: A support e-mail address complying with "mailto:" URI scheme.

Term.Name: Support Website
Term.Definition: A support website expressed as a URL.

Term.Name: Telephone Helpline
Term.Definition: A telephone helpline number complying with [IETF RFC 2806] "tel:" URI scheme.

Term.Name: Segmentation
Term.Definition: The reference points to segmentation information

Term.Name: Static Segmentation
Term.Definition: Relation: The content referenced by this pointer is "static" segmentation metadata which will not change as the content progresses.

Term.Name: Live Segmentation
Term.Definition: Relation: The content referenced by this pointer is "live" segmentation metadata which will change dynamically as the content progresses. Once the content has completed transmission the segmentation metadata will not be updated.

Term.Name: Live & Post Segmentation
Term.Definition: Relation: The content referenced by this pointer is "live" segmentation metadata which will change dynamically as the content progresses. It may also be updated after the content has completed transmission.

Term.Name: Post Segmentation
Term.Definition: Relation: The content referenced by this pointer is segmentation metadata which will only be available after the content has completed transmission.

Term.Name: TVA RMPI document
Term.Definition: The reference points to TVA-compliant rights information that the broadcaster and/or rights holder provides, for informative purposes only. Example: "The user, during the process of deciding whether to select a programme for acquisition, can view information in the TVA RMPI document for that programme."

Term.Name: Content Package
Term.Definition: The resource points to a content package.

Term.Name: Promotional Still Image
Term.Definition: The resource points to a promotional still image for the content programme.

Term.Name: Broadcaster Website
Term.Definition: The resource points to a more general web site for the broadcaster.

Term.Name: HasFormat
Term.Definition: The described resource pre-existed the referenced resource, which is essentially the same intellectual content presented in another format.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: IsFormatOf
Term.Definition: The described resource is the same intellectual content of the referenced resource, but presented in another format.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: HasPart
Term.Definition: The described resource includes the referenced resource either physically or logically.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: IsPartOf
Term.Definition: The described resource is a physical or logical part of the referenced resource.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: IsReferencedBy
Term.Definition: The described resource is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the referenced resource.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: IsReplacedBy
Term.Definition: The described resource is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the referenced resource.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: IsRequiredBy
Term.Definition: The described resource is required by the referenced resource, either physically or logically.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: HasVersion
Term.Definition: The described resource has a version, edition, or adaptation, namely, the referenced resource.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: References
Term.Definition: The described resource references, cites, or otherwise points to the referenced resource.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: Replaces
Term.Definition: The described resource supplants, displaces, or supersedes the referenced resource.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: Requires
Term.Definition: The described resource requires the referenced resource to support its function, delivery, or coherence of content.(Dublin Core)

Term.Name: Review Information
Term.Definition: By default the reference points to a review or critique of the resource that may be of interest to the user in deciding whether to continue to watch, download, etc. Example: The user can look at the additional information and use it to decide whether to continue watching a programme

Term.Name: HasReviewInformation
Term.Definition: The reference points to a review or critique of the resource

Term.Name: IsReviewInformationFor
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource that is the subject of the review

Term.Name: Preview
Term.Definition: By default, in complement to a Trailer, the reference points to a preview of the resource in a different format (e.g. longer sequences or interactive content) to assess e.g. previously advertised content or services.

Term.Name: HasPreview
Term.Definition: In complement to a Trailer, the reference points to a preview of the resource in a different format (e.g. longer sequences or interactive content) to assess e.g. previously advertised content or services.

Term.Name: IsPreviewOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource addressed by the current preview.

Term.Name: Current Broadcast
Term.Definition: Relation: The content referenced by this pointer is the current broadcast content.

Term.Name: Package Main Content
Term.Definition: A pointer to the main content component of a Package.

Term.Name: ChannelIdentification
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to a channel identification or ident of the currently described resource.

Term.Name: IsChannelIdentificationOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the channel/service whose identity the current resource reinforces.

Term.Name: HasChannelIdentification
Term.Definition: The reference points to a channel identification of the current resource.

Term.Name: BestOf
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to a resource collecting best-of selections from the currently described resource.

Term.Name: IsBestOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the show or brand whose best-of selections are collected in the current resource.

Term.Name: HasBestOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to a resource collecting best-of selections from the current resource.

Term.Name: AdditionalMaterial
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to additional, supplementary material such as an extended interview or report or an additional music track.

Term.Name: IsAdditionalMaterialFor
Term.Definition: The reference points to the programme for which the current resource is additional material.

Term.Name: HasAdditionalMaterial
Term.Definition: The reference points to additional material for the current resource.

Term.Name: Extract
Term.Definition: By default, the reference points to an extract of the current resource.

Term.Name: IsExtractOf
Term.Definition: The reference points to the resource of which the current resource is an extract.

Term.Name: HasExtract
Term.Definition: The reference points to an extract of the current resource.
